com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleManagerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleNodeConfig
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDeviceConfig
        • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManagerConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class BleManagerConfig
extends BleDeviceConfig
    Provides a number of options to pass to the BleManager.get(Context, BleManagerConfig) singleton getter or BleManager.setConfig(BleManagerConfig). Use Interval.DISABLED or null to disable any time-based options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BleManagerConfig.DefaultScanFilter
      Convenience implementation of BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter which filters using a whitelist of known primary advertising UUIDs passed in to the constructor.
      static interface  BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter
      An optional whitelisting mechanism for scanning.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDeviceConfig

        BleDeviceConfig.BondFilter, BleDeviceConfig.DefaultBondFilter

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleNodeConfig

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Interval autoScanActiveTime
      Default is Interval.DISABLED - Length of time in seconds that the library will automatically scan for devices.
      Interval autoScanDelayAfterResume
      Default is 0.5 seconds - Unless Interval.DISABLED, this option will kick off a scan for autoScanActiveTime seconds autoScanDelayAfterResume seconds after BleManager.onResume() is called.
      boolean autoScanDuringOta
      Default is false - set this to allow or disallow autoscanning while any BleDevice is BleDeviceState.PERFORMING_OTA.
      Interval autoScanPauseInterval
      Default is 3.0 seconds - Length of time in seconds between automatic scan pulses defined by autoScanActiveTime.
      Interval autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded
      Default is Interval.DISABLED - Same as autoScanPauseInterval except this value is used while the app is paused.
      Interval autoUpdateRate
      Default is 0.033666666666666664 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks.

      static double DEFAULT_AUTO_UPDATE_RATE 
      static double DEFAULT_UH_OH_CALLBACK_THROTTLE 
      BleManager.DiscoveryListener defaultDiscoveryListener
      Default is null - can also be set post-construction with BleManager.setListener_Discovery(DiscoveryListener), which will override the implementation provided here.
      BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter defaultScanFilter
      Default is null, meaning no filtering - all discovered devices will be piped through your BleManager.DiscoveryListener instance and added to the internal list of BleManager.
      boolean enableCrashResolver
      Default is false - this option may help mitigate crashes with "Unfortunately, Bluetooth Share has stopped" error messages.
      boolean enableCrashResolverForReset
      Default is true - this option gates whether the "crash resolver" described in enableCrashResolver is invoked during a BleManager.reset() operation to forcefully clear the memory that causes the crash.
      Interval idealMinScanTime
      Default is BleDeviceConfig.DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Minimum amount of time in seconds that the library strives to give to a scanning operation.
      boolean loggingEnabled
      Default is false - basically only useful for developers working on the library itself.
      boolean manageCpuWakeLock
      Default is true - requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission in your app's manifest file.
      boolean revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded
      Default is true - SweetBlue uses BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) by default but for unknown reasons this can fail sometimes.
      boolean stopScanOnPause
      Default is true - makes it so BleManager.stopScan() is called automatically after BleManager.onPause().
      Interval uhOhCallbackThrottle
      Default is 30.0 seconds - BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh callbacks from BleManager.UhOhListener can be a little spammy at times so this is an option to throttle them back on a per-BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh basis.
      List<UuidNameMap> uuidNameMaps
      Default is null - optional, only used if loggingEnabled is true.

        Constant Field Values

      • loggingEnabled

        public boolean loggingEnabled
        Default is false - basically only useful for developers working on the library itself. May also be useful for providing context when reporting bugs.

      • enableCrashResolver

        public boolean enableCrashResolver
        Default is false - this option may help mitigate crashes with "Unfortunately, Bluetooth Share has stopped" error messages. See https://github.com/RadiusNetworks/bluetooth-crash-resolver or http://developer.radiusnetworks.com/2014/04/02/a-solution-for-android-bluetooth-crashes.html or Google "Bluetooth Crash Resolver" for more information.

        NOTE:" This option gates a "proactive" approach towards mitigating the above-described crash.
        See Also:
        enableCrashResolverForReset

      • enableCrashResolverForReset

        public boolean enableCrashResolverForReset
        Default is true - this option gates whether the "crash resolver" described in enableCrashResolver is invoked during a BleManager.reset() operation to forcefully clear the memory that causes the crash.
        See Also:
        enableCrashResolver

      • stopScanOnPause

        public boolean stopScanOnPause
        Default is true - makes it so BleManager.stopScan() is called automatically after BleManager.onPause(). If you're doing an infinite scan (e.g. by calling BleManager.startScan(), i.e. no timeout), then the scan will automatically continue after BleManager.onResume() is called.
        See Also:
        BleManager.onPause()

      • autoScanDuringOta

        public boolean autoScanDuringOta
        Default is false - set this to allow or disallow autoscanning while any BleDevice is BleDeviceState.PERFORMING_OTA. If false, then OTAs may complete faster if you're periodically scanning through autoScanActiveTime or BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval). BleManager.startScan() will still start a scan regardless.

      • revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded

        public boolean revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded
        Default is true - SweetBlue uses BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) by default but for unknown reasons this can fail sometimes. In this case SweetBlue can revert to using classic bluetooth discovery through BluetoothAdapter.startDiscovery(). Be aware that classic discovery may not discover some or any advertising BLE devices, nor will it provide a BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent.scanRecord() or BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent.advertisedServices() to BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.onEvent(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent). Most likely you will be forced to filter on name only for your implementation of BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.onEvent(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.ScanEvent). As such this is meant as a better-than-nothing back-up solution for BLE scanning.

      • manageCpuWakeLock

        public boolean manageCpuWakeLock
        Default is true - requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission in your app's manifest file. It should look like this: <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK" /> Sets whether the library will attempt to obtain a wake lock in certain situations. For now the only situation is when there are no remote bluetooth devices BleDeviceState.CONNECTED but one or more devices are BleDeviceState.RECONNECTING_LONG_TERM. The wake lock will be released when devices are reconnected (e.g. from coming back into range) or when reconnection is stopped either through BleDevice.disconnect() or returning BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.Please.stopRetrying() from BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.onEvent(BleNodeConfig.ReconnectFilter.ReconnectEvent). Wake locks will also be released if Bluetooth is turned off either from the App or OS settings. Note that Android itself uses some kind of implicit wake lock when you are connected to one or more devices and requires no explicit wake lock nor any extra permissions to do so.

      • uhOhCallbackThrottle

        public Interval uhOhCallbackThrottle
        Default is 30.0 seconds - BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh callbacks from BleManager.UhOhListener can be a little spammy at times so this is an option to throttle them back on a per-BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh basis. Set this to Interval.DISABLED to receive all every BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh and manage them yourself.
        See Also:
        BleManager.UhOhListener

      • autoScanDelayAfterResume

        public Interval autoScanDelayAfterResume
        Default is 0.5 seconds - Unless Interval.DISABLED, this option will kick off a scan for autoScanActiveTime seconds autoScanDelayAfterResume seconds after BleManager.onResume() is called.

      • autoScanActiveTime

        public Interval autoScanActiveTime
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - Length of time in seconds that the library will automatically scan for devices. Used in conjunction with autoScanPauseInterval, autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded, and autoScanDelayAfterResume, this option allows the library to periodically send off scan "pulses" that last autoScanActiveTime seconds. Use BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) to adjust this behavior while the library is running. If either autoScanActiveTime or autoScanPauseInterval is Interval.DISABLED then auto scanning is disabled. It can also be turned off with BleManager.stopPeriodicScan().
        See Also:
        autoScanPauseInterval, BleManager.startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval), BleManager.stopPeriodicScan()

      • autoScanPauseInterval

        public Interval autoScanPauseInterval
        Default is 3.0 seconds - Length of time in seconds between automatic scan pulses defined by autoScanActiveTime.
        See Also:
        autoScanActiveTime

      • autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded

        public Interval autoScanPauseTimeWhileAppIsBackgrounded
        Default is Interval.DISABLED - Same as autoScanPauseInterval except this value is used while the app is paused.
        See Also:
        autoScanPauseInterval, BleManager.onPause()

      • idealMinScanTime

        public Interval idealMinScanTime
        Default is BleDeviceConfig.DEFAULT_MINIMUM_SCAN_TIME seconds - Minimum amount of time in seconds that the library strives to give to a scanning operation.

      • autoUpdateRate

        public Interval autoUpdateRate
        Default is 0.033666666666666664 seconds - The rate at which the library's internal update loop ticks. Generally shouldn't need to be changed. You can set this to Interval.DISABLED and call BleManager.update(double) yourself if you want to tie the library in to an existing update loop used in your application.

      • defaultScanFilter

        public BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter defaultScanFilter
        Default is null, meaning no filtering - all discovered devices will be piped through your BleManager.DiscoveryListener instance and added to the internal list of BleManager.
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter

      • defaultDiscoveryListener

        public BleManager.DiscoveryListener defaultDiscoveryListener
        Default is null - can also be set post-construction with BleManager.setListener_Discovery(DiscoveryListener), which will override the implementation provided here.
        See Also:
        BleManager.DiscoveryListener

      • uuidNameMaps

        public List<UuidNameMap> uuidNameMaps
        Default is null - optional, only used if loggingEnabled is true. Provides a look-up table so logs can show the name associated with a UUID along with its numeric string.

    • Constructor Detail

        Creates a BleManagerConfig with all default options set. See each member of this class for what the default options are set to.

        loggingEnabled_in - Sets loggingEnabled.
